website_summaries.verdict: A light-duty, high-quality tool designed for those who plan to use it only occasionally.
pros: Pen grip is easy to master
cons: Battery recharge time can be lengthy

customer_reviews.title: where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: can't believe i've waited so long to get a dremel. i love this thing. i want to do everything with it, even things that don't require a dremel. when i'm bored in bed i'll often pull it out and smooth my nails out while watching TV. i use the small sandpapered head to grind down my conure's beak tip because he's too stupid to chew the various cuttle bones, flavored and not, i've provided him with. i can't wait to use it for lots of household and hobby projects. the battery lasts a long time and the tool comes with terrific accessories, a convenient battery charger, and is extremely simple to change out the accessories and such. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: bugpig

customer_reviews.title: Great tech support, poor quality control and user manual directions
customer_reviews.text: Like a few other people have mentioned, this kit does not come with the proper collar sleeve or whatever they call it so none of the accessories fit, fall out and are mismatched and useless, but after talking to their tech support, I was guided to swap out the collar from my old tool and get it to work, so I'll give five stars to tech support and zero for their quality control. UPDATE THE USER INSTRUCTIONS AND QUALITY CONTROL!
customer_reviews.author: Ora Moose

customer_reviews.title: no power at all!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st dremmel so I was not able to correlate the model number and voltage with the amount of power the tool had. Boy was I disappointed. It has maybe 25% of the amount of power I need and I'm only doing light arts and crafts projects trying to cut through thin plastic, cardboard, and popsicle sticks. I have a 10v makita cordless drill that can go through concrete, so what's the deal here? I think it's been too long to return it but I wish I had immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin P. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I am diabetic and elderly. I have a very hard time cutting and trimming my toenails. I was going to the foot doctor every few months to have him cut and trim them. He had used a Dremel tool to smooth them out. This gave me the idea to order this to use one myself to keep them trimmed so I don't have to spend my much needed dollars at the doctors office. It works exactly what I needed it to do. It may be an unconventional way, but it certainly works for me. Maybe this review can help other elderly with the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Marinettta Mosier

customer_reviews.title: Battery fails after less than 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this thing for 3 months, it worked great at first and after the first charge the battery at fill charge lasts a few minutes before it barely has charge. I’ve used this maybe 10 times in 3 months to do dog nails and now it is not even strong enough to do a full paw before it’s nearly out of charge. What a waste of money, avoid.
customer_reviews.author: GFX

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase! You can tell right away that it isn't quite of the quality that the more expensive Dremels are, but for the price I cannot complain. I have used this to carved wood, cut tile, sand, drill holes and as long as the battery is fully charged it performs wonderfully. The battery life isn't the best, but since it comes with a charger it hasn't been a big issue. Perfect for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: S. H.

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed to have lost my money on this item
customer_reviews.text: I received this product and was not able to use it. I brought it for my son, as a gift. I was disappointed to have lost my money on this item, because once it was opened, it was past the return date. The attachments, enclosed in the box, did not fit the Dremel 7700. We tried each one, thinking an attachment was put in the box by mistake, when it belongs with another Dremel series. We tried each attachment and none fit. I never used it and have read reviews, from other reviewers, that had the stated the same complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Junk
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk absolutely the worst tool i have ever bought. After letting the battery charge for a full day just to be sure i used this tool at a remote location where i could not recharge it. The dremel lasted 2 cuts for a total of less than 10 minutes of running. I was left high and dry an hour from home on a repair that needed to be done. Thanks for putting out a product that is less than worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Magee

customer_reviews.title: Battery only lasted for minutes on a simple job.
customer_reviews.text: I was trimming some plastic and the battery only lasted for a few minutes. This was after letting it charge overnight as it instructs before first use. I had to quit what I was doing and run up to Home Depot to purchase a plug in model that could handle the easy job I was doing. I wouldn’t waste your time with this battery operated model.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY LIFE IS JUNK
customer_reviews.text: You get 10 minutes on "high" and 20 minutes on "low". Yes, you heard me right, 10 MINUTES ON HIGH. The battery life is absolute junk because it's so small and barely holds a charge. And get this, it TAKES 2 HOURS TO CHARGE. 10 minutes of use and then a 2 hour charge. This dremel makes working on projects within a reasonable amount of time IMPOSSIBLE. Get a corded Dremel or some other rotary tool (not made by Dremel, obviously) if you just can't live without cordless. Do not buy this junk. It is NOT worth the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: Good for tough dog toenails
customer_reviews.text: This dremel tool was a great alternative to clippers, which my dogs absolutely HATE. My stubborn dog - who doesn't ever sit through having his toenails clipped - will actually lay down and relax while I'm using this (he is calm during the low setting but not so much when I kick it up to high). The rechargable battery is great - I can get through both dogs' nails before the battery life is exhausted and it needs another charge. Also it's constructed really well so it feels sturdy in your hand. Would highly recommend if you have a fidgety anxious dog that doesn't like having their nails clipped!
customer_reviews.author: WiscoShopper

customer_reviews.title: I had an older Dremel from like 1897 and this thing is like from 2078
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Dremel from like 1897 and this thing is like from 2078! Super fast, keeps the charge longer and gets the job done! I use it mostly for my dogs' nails. Love the extra accessories. It's surprisingly fast on the low setting and super fast on high setting. It's not that loud. Which I love bc it doesn't freak my dogs out. Absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: V. HarrisTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn't last long, usually isn't charged, and fails.
customer_reviews.text: So frustrated that I bought this model instead of the corded version. First off the battery doesn't stay charged long so I couldn't get projects done without the delay of recharging the battery. Secondly, since the dremel lives in a box the charger isn't always plugged in and keeping the battery topped off so all projects needing a Dremel always required charging the battery first, usually overnight, then remembering to do the project the next day (yes this is user error). Thirdly, the battery has now died a year or so after purchase, and so now the dremel is useless. Buy the corded, plug in version!
customer_reviews.author: gbramling

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery. Otherwise ok.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first cordless dremel I have owned. Have owned many of the corded versions that I have liked just fine and would rate all of them 5 stars. Unfortunately, the battery on this one is junk. I have charged and discharged this thing properly since new and it has never been even decent. Fully charged it is very weak and will only last a matter of minutes with a very light work load. I will try another battery, but at this point I totally regret this purchase. To think I was worried about buying an off brand. Ha!
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this at the recommendation of my vet to do a couple of dogs nails. I'm still getting used to it but so far it's doing the job for me. I did purchase a spare battery as there is no indication on the unit to show battery status. I'm not a big fan of Ni-Cad batteries, actually I don't like them at all but the Dremels that have Lithium batteries are priced way to high for my limited use. I say this but if the Ni-Cads work as poorly as I expect I may well bit the bullet and upgrade, time will tell Edit: down graded my review due to the lack of any kind of battery indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Carson Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Cannot change certain heads without Pliers or clamps
customer_reviews.text: So this device comes with a simple button that stops the dremel shaft from spinning so that way you can easily unscrew certain heads that are held in place by a screw top. The problem is that who ever designed this had about half a brain because the lock doesn't prevent the inner portion of the shaft from spinning only the outside. Which makes removing bits that fit into that middle shaft impossible to remove without having to grab an extra set of pliers to clamp the inner shaft and prevent it from spinning along with you when you remove a screw topped bit....
customer_reviews.author: Hopeless Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Battery Does Not Last Long At All
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed in this Dremel. It is such a fabulous idea but the power and longevity of the battery were really lacking. I wish I would have spent the money on a corded one. It was not worth the money. I expected much more from this tool. It is very lightweight which is nice and it is easier to maneuver than the corded style. But the lack of power is disappointing and the short time the battery works turned it into a paperweight at my house.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A. Jamison

customer_reviews.title: Stripped a bolt? no problem.
customer_reviews.text: Let me just start off with i really needed a dremel . It appears that no one in my neighborhood has one handy. Delivery was fast and timely. Straight out of the box everything that was listed was included. Battery came with a slight charge so i put it to use right away and man i must say this thing really works! Pros: Super light weight Rechargeable batteries Cordless Accessories Great size for those tight spots ( example: car engine manifold) Cons: Being that it's cordless power output sometimes isn't as consistent but still gets the job done. No option to plug into a wall outlet Having to recharge ( not really a con )
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Must-have tool for every woodworking shop!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my grandson for his new foray into woodworking. From my perspective, the two most critical tools for a woodworkers workshop are a table jigsaw and a Dremel Moto-Tool. This model is perfect for the beginner as it is cordless and rechargeable and can accept all sorts of add-ons. It will be used for minor sawing, sanding, smoothing, drilling, and who knows what all else. I am eager to show my grandson how to use this great little tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bassman

customer_reviews.title: Rust never sleeps.
customer_reviews.text: The user manual has more information about extra doodads to buy than clear instructions as to use this Dremel. So I have never used my Dremel at all. I wanted to get rid of RUST in tight spots. The directions include more marketing space for extra things to buy than clear cut directions for Dremel I had hoped to be able to use.
customer_reviews.author: nanajudi

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to turn off - Engineering Fail
customer_reviews.text: Putting the OFF position of the power switch in the middle (between the low and high setting) was a terrible idea. 1) It's counterintuitive. OFF should be achieved by going all the way to the end. HIGH-OFF-LOW makes no sense. 2) The OFF position is very touchy. If you are even slightly off-center in either direction...the power comes on. I've never encountered a power tool that was so difficult to turn off. 3) Since the power switch protrudes outward when in the OFF position, it is easy to bump it so that it turns back on. The act of setting it down on the work bench frequently turns it on. Frustrating tool to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey-D

customer_reviews.title: Tool life sucks
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to place with my chainsaw carry case to sharpen the chain in the field. In the third season it stopped working. After examination I saw that the flimsy copper contacts had corroded enough to become dielectric. Tried to remove corrosion with steel wool ... big mistake ... broke off a contact. Junk. Originally I purchased this for $40 in 2017. Trust me, you don't need this for $140
customer_reviews.author: verger

customer_reviews.title: High Power didn't last 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I've used a dremmel on my great dane's nails long ago and decided to do so again for my older dane. After 2 full days of charging, I was able to use it for 5 minutes before it petered out. How is that useful? Returning. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Need Help! These do not operate correctly!
customer_reviews.text: All three of these Dremels are having a problem from day one. It involves the power switch. They turn on and operates on low, but not in high.The switch just goes to the left, but the high speed will not kick in. I do not want to push harder and possibly break the switch. Please advise. I have sent this in before asking for help. No one responded to me! Now this says return window "closed" the other day! Nice. Dremel 7700 - 1/15 MultiPro 7.2 Volt Cordless.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Chapdelaine

customer_reviews.title: Wont last long.
customer_reviews.text: Fully charged battery has barely any power anymore. I used it for maybe 25 minutes total. (here and there that is...) It will spin but nothing you can use it for. Also the battery doesn't (and hasn't) made a solid connection since i got it. I have had to wiggle the battery into the tool most of the time just to get a connection and its more awkward than useful. Maybe get a higher grade model....? Maybe I got a lemon...? I wish I could make lemonade. I got screwed. Hope this helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: Wakkah Wakkah !!!

customer_reviews.title: Light duty use
customer_reviews.text: The high/low speed switch is a bit touchy. I have to play around with it to get it in just the right spot for high speed. I should have just purchased the corded model. The battery life obviously depends on what you use this for. I was drilling small holes in jewelry stones and the battery gets pretty warm, even prolonged use with the polishing wheel gets the battery heated up. The battery charger gets it up to full charge in a fairly short amount of time. Just not exactly what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: rondrei

customer_reviews.title: Horribly manufactured compared to their professional wired version
customer_reviews.text: This potentially is a great tool if the battery was actually manufactured to fit this Dremel. Allas after replacing this tool 3 times and writing similar review the manufacturer remains deaf to my reviews. Bosch should have given a directive to the foreign OEM manufacturer to make changes to the battery seating as well as a switch that needs to be more like that of their professional Dremel, since the switch works intermittently in each and every drill I used. Robert Bosh shame on you, I thought you kept higher standards.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Drake

customer_reviews.title: Good for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to do small projects on an old car, specifically to cut off small bolts holding on exterior trim pieces. It’s nice and light weight. The tools it comes with are handy. As someone who has never used a Dremel before, the instructions on how to swap collets and attachments could be better. I deferred to YouTube videos for help with that. Because it’s cordless, it doesn’t have a lot of power for cutting or bigger jobs. I’d recommend a corded one for serious auto work but this is good for small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie D

customer_reviews.title: Good value, definitely works, why is it still NiCad in 2019?
customer_reviews.text: We mainly use this for grinding down dog nails, though it's perfectly functional for regular Dremel tasks. It's a perfectly adequate Dremel, though there are such better battery technologies available I'm kind of surprised it still uses NiCad. Battery longevity/memory is a concern, but for the price and purpose I can't complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Mason A Perry

customer_reviews.title: A great tool to own.
customer_reviews.text: Dremel is the standard in hand held rotary tools. The vast array of different bits makes this the swiss army knife of any tool box. The battery life is a bit disappointing, but I have an extra so I can keep one on the charger at all times. I also recommend the quick-release adapter. They are inexpensive and really add value to the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Curry

customer_reviews.title: What happened to DREMEL??
customer_reviews.text: I loved this Dremel when I bought it October 2016 but... less than a year later it stopped working at the ‘HI’ setting and now it doesn’t work at all. I didn’t bother to purchase the extended warranty because my other Dremel (a model 395) has been working for years! Why would this one be of lesser quality? How can a Customer base stay loyal if Dremel isn’t loyal to offering a quality product?
customer_reviews.author: o2b_moi

customer_reviews.title: Short review
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to grind my dogs nails. It works very well for this, however, the grinder does give off what I thunk is excessive noise and I had to slowly introduce this noise to the dog so she wouldn't freak out. I tried using it on the slow speed which generates less noise but grinding is very slow with a lot of vibration, the high setting grinds the nails fast and works pretty well. Just loud for the size of the unit. Of course this is just my opinion as far as noise.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dog nails
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to smooth our dogs' nails and it works perfect! I did end up buying 120 grit sanding drums as the 60 grit this comes with is a bit coarse for the nails. The pet version of this is a lower volt battery with less accessories, so if you are just using for your pets, you could go that route. But I recommend buying this version so you can also use it for crafts if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great for manicuring my dogs nails
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Dremel device to use to sand and manicure my three dogs nails. This is the same unit my veterinarian has and uses on animals in his practice. I found it to work exceptional in sanding down the nails of my three dogs and took very little time to learn how to use it at the correct speed. I did practice on a few sticks first to test how much pressure I should use so I didn't injure any of my dogs in my learning process! My dogs range in size from very large to very small and this Dremel with the variable speed does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This dremel is perfect for small applications around the house
customer_reviews.text: This dremel is perfect for small applications around the house. It has plenty of power to get the job done. I have used it to round off sharp edges and widen holes for threading wire in tight places. I especially love the convenience of this cordless unit. I am able to take it anywhere and it's nice not having to worry about staying close to an power outlet. I would definitely recommend this product. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: She is such a sweet girl. She was very cooperative
customer_reviews.text: It came slightly charged and it worked very well for my dog's nails. She did not flinch or anything. She is such a sweet girl. She was very cooperative. I was pleasantly surprised by how quietly the motor operated. I watched several YouTube videos about the 7300, which is the pet version. Many reviewers recommended the 7700. I was scared to use it until I spoke with the groomer and my vet. They both use the same model.
customer_reviews.author: Tealove

customer_reviews.title: but it's useless to me without that piece
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't come with a collet – an essential piece, which connects any of the bits or accessories to the tool itself – and no instructions on where to purchase one. I got this overnighted because I needed to start work on a project tonight, but it's useless to me without that piece, so paying for the extra shipping was a waste of money as I cannot move forward with the project. I'm perplexed and extremely disappointed. This might be as great a tool as everyone says, but I have no way of knowing that because I can't use it out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: (If you want a good quality power tool
customer_reviews.text: Battery runs out after an hour of use! And it takes longer to charge than use. It's a toy not a tool. Time is money, so do yourself a favor and get a dremel 4000 with a cord instead. (If you want a good quality power tool.)
customer_reviews.author: Kaisa Saulin

customer_reviews.title: Paid for New, Received Used.
customer_reviews.text: I got a used item that was sold as new. Didn't open it right away as we were on vacation, so I'm stuck with it, but c'mon - if you are going to sell used items as new, at least put in some sort of effort to make it look new. Ugh. I use this dremel to file my dog's nails, and it's definitely better than "doggy dremels". Just take the time to research how to do this properly (a few great videos on youtube) to avoid stressing or injuring your dog.
customer_reviews.author: Puproar

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros. ⬇️ Easy to use. Easy to hold. Powerful. Good battery life. Essential for DIY projects. Cons. ⬇️ Wish it came with more attachments. —————————— The pros outweigh the cons. I highly recommend this product. I hope this was helpful. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Alex the Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Won't Hold Charge/Loose Contacts
customer_reviews.text: I have used corded Dremels and have been very happy, so I expected this little cordless one to be as good. Nope! Either the battery pack won't hold a charge, or it loosens just enough after a couple of uses that the contacts won't line up. I need a cordless one for dog shows, where power is not always available, and am very disappointed. A check of Dremel forums shows this is a chronic issue with the 7700.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Faulty drill.
customer_reviews.text: “Hi” speed setting kept malfunctioning. Had to flip the switch to “Lo” speed, then back to Hi” speed. Very unpleasant when under the car working on the exhaust system. Returned it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Crosbie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to grind my dogs nails.
customer_reviews.text: After a few bad clippings with a nail clipper I decided going to a dremal. I spent every day for about a week just providing treats to my dog next to the dremal in sight. Then randomly I would turn it on and give her treats. Eventually she paid no mind to it and I was able to grind one nail. I treated her and praised her a lot. Now I can do a whole paw before she decides she’s had enough. It’s great for this purpose. I’m sure now that I have it I’ll use it for it’s intended purpose too.
customer_reviews.author: D. LevinTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: ... my 6 year old Dremel that used to look like a gun with the handle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 6 year old Dremel that used to look like a gun with the handle. I use these to trim my Great Danes nails and can say it works well, but only 4 speeds now not 10 and it's very hard to hold with the new design. If they come back with the gun style handle one I will toss this one and buy the old handle style again.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Very Little Power, & It Takes A Tremendous Amount Of Time To Do Something Small.
customer_reviews.text: So after using the cutter attachment, it couldn't even cut thru 1/8" particleboard or cut a small bolt. Battery life is terrible, and you can grab the empty head at 7200 RPM's and literally stop it. It may be OK to use this for a light hobby project, but that's about it. I'll try to get a few bucks for it at my next garage sale. Would never recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Dremel Sanders: Talons to Toe Nails
customer_reviews.text: Mostly bought it for trimming my dog’s nails. In the past, trimming nails with different tools has been... eventful. One of us can smell fear... my fear. He may only have two paws clipped and two paws grinded down with the dremel and half a bag of treats gone, but that is like 14 more nails then the last few attempts. It’s a sigh of relief for both of us. Maybe a bit of pride on my side. Worth. Every. Penny.
customer_reviews.author: ArcticSunshine

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I work at petsmart, bought this because my old top to my dremel would die when touching the dogs nail. the inside was turning blue and becoming corroded. I got this one the other day and has been working AMAZING. I have no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Baumann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and works great for large dog toenails
customer_reviews.text: My 100 lb Golden Retriever's toenails requiring trimming at least once a month. Because my eyes don't see the red veins (color-deficiency) in the nails I cannot determine how close to trim using blade cutters. This grinder allows me to visually determine safe trimming and the dog doesn't object as much. I keep two batteries on charge so I always have a charged one to use.
customer_reviews.author: Thule1

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Runs out of batteries fairly quickly if you use it for cutting or other tough jobs. Probably should use an AC powered tool for the tougher jobs anyway. One negative: the on/off switch is not easy to get to the off position when turning on and off quickly. It will slide too far and pass off to the other speed. Sometimes I think I turned it off and set it down and it starts to run.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, needs a li-ion battery
customer_reviews.text: I personally don't have an issue with this product other than to state why in the heck would they use old battery technology in this....Seemed to work good and the price was very reasonable, didn't need anything too powerful so it works for fine for my purposes. First thing I did was to completely disassemble the battery pack and to make my own li-ion battery pack by getting two 3.6v li-ion 18650 batteries and a charger. Sure it's not pretty but at least I have a better battery pack that's environmentally friendly. They should really offer a replacement li-ion battery pack for this.
customer_reviews.author: Electronic Technician

customer_reviews.title: It's okay but...
customer_reviews.text: Dremel makes great stuff but I'm only giving this little guy three stars. The first time I tried to charge it I had a problem, one side of the battery doesn't want to stay clipped into the charger. I've tried everything but it doesn't want to stay in and it stops while I'm using it. I have to duct tape it to the charger for it to charge. I was going to send it back but figured I could live with it since I don't use it that much, I mostly use my cord unit anyway.
customer_reviews.author: nightskyTop Contributor: Model Airplanes

customer_reviews.title: Dog nails, great
customer_reviews.text: use it to trim up my labs nails, it works great. Holds a fantastic charge, spins plenty fast for pretty quick trims. Any faster and I have to believe it would overheat the dogs nail. Highly recommend and I'm a pretty tough critic.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Fiordaliso

customer_reviews.title: Excellent nail file for dogs
customer_reviews.text: This Drexel. tool is an excellent nail file for my dog. It is used by professional dog groomers. I can do all 4 paws of my German Shepherd in 10 minutes or less. I tried the cheaper one 1st called PediPaws. The motor is too weak and would literally grind to a halt. I couldn't even trim my own finger nails with it. PediPaws was very disappointing to me and my dog. Don't waste your money on it. Instead, spend a little more and get a lot more. As the old saying goes, "You get what you pay for". That says it all.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: While useful, this Dremel is unfortunately lacking when it comes to pure torque and power. I often have trouble with the motor just stopping after what I would consider reasonable pressure, and there hardly seems to be a need for multiple speed settings, as they both seem to perform about the same. Still, though, it has its uses, mostly when using the sanding bits. It's a dreadful tool for cutting, however, and even the lightest materials seem to give it trouble. Give it a pass, save up for a more expensive and higher quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not sold on this.
customer_reviews.text: Had an old craftsman rotory tool for the longest time. Figured I’d finally get a replacement. Not to impressed with the power. Used the cut off wheel to cut some screws and it would always big down. Made it thru 3 screws until the cut off wheel broke. I would thing that this would be able to handle a job like that but apparently that’s considered “heavy duty” and this tool is obvitver light duty at best.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY WILL NOT CHARGE!  DRILL NEVER WORKED
customer_reviews.text: This product has not worked upon arrival. The battery holds a charge for less than 1 minute! I've tried several times, left it for several hours and overnight but I get good power for 15 seconds tops and then it starts slowing down. This makes it absolutely WORTHLESS. And what really makes me angry is that I have a couple of DREMEL products and I trusted the name, didn't even really consider any other product which makes me a fool who is out $40 for nothing. DO NOT BUY THIS POS$@#$!
customer_reviews.author: M Kate Porter

customer_reviews.title: good for last minute cosplay prop making
customer_reviews.text: It works well, but battery needs to last longer. Also, while using it for the first time, one of the removable pieces broke. good for last minute cosplay prop making.
customer_reviews.author: erving

customer_reviews.title: Great for Our Pup's Nails
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Dremel 761-03, which my wife felt was underpowered. This newer model runs at slightly higher speeds. Once the puppy was acclimated to the higher pitch, she seemed to be calmer with the process. We've since discovered that this model is widely used by members of our breed club, as well as a trainer of ours who also does grooming. Also comes with a nice selection of bits. My wife switched from sanding drum to one of the tapered stones for nail grinding.
customer_reviews.author: TervFan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with no cord to worry about
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my dog's toenails. The cord on the corded version kept getting in the way, but the cordless is nice without having to worry about the cord. It has good power for thick toenails and is not real noisy. My dog's seem to like it better than a corded tool. So far so good! I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Denny L McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this package! The included attachments do ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this package! The included attachments do not fit the Collet - you'll have to buy other products to make this work.
customer_reviews.author: MMC

customer_reviews.title: Overall, works fine, not great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to grind my dog's nail. It's much louder than I would like as my dogs get a little nervous, but not unreasonably so. It's not quite as powerful as I had hoped and it takes a while to get my dogs' nails ground down. As the battery looses it's charge the power goes down slowly as well. If you keep it well charged it works just fine, but don't expect to get anything done when it is half charged. The battery takes quite a while to recharge as well, which can be annoying. Overall, works fine, not great.
customer_reviews.author: CAH

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and effective
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this primarily to keep my dog's nails trimmed, and it works pretty well. For whatever reason, she is terrified to have her nails trimmed with traditional nail clippers, but I use one of the included sanding bits once a week and we breeze right through it. The battery lasts for a while and it's fairly quiet. It feels a little cheap (because it is), but it's pretty chunky so it's pretty easy to hold on to. I'm sure it works well for non-dog-related tasks, but I haven't found any other uses for it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dog Nails
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for nearly two years to trim my dog's nails. I used to spend $13 every few weeks to get them done professionally. Now, I just sit down with him outside and do it myself. This $24 purchase paid for itself in the first 2 uses. And, it was great to have around when my son and I were making Pinewood Derby cars for Cub Scouts. There are plenty of other uses for it, but even if I only ever used it for those two things, I would be utterly pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Its great but the battery is really bad
customer_reviews.text: I like its portability and its pretty useful. My only issue with it is the battery. This thing getsHOT if you are using it for more than a minute. The dremel and battery get to hot to even hold it. Battery life lasts about 10 minutes and takes HOURS to recharge. This same tool with a better battery would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: Buying 4 batteries every year, doesn't make this product worth the investment. Get the better batteries and stop the waste. I have two batteries that I rotate in and out, but now both are dead and one is only 2 months old. The charger can also go bad and not charge your batteries. The unit works fine IF the batteries can power it. Don't waste your tie though, go bigger!
customer_reviews.author: albert lewis

customer_reviews.title: So nice to not have to plug in every time I ...
customer_reviews.text: After years of using Dremels I finally broke down and got this one. So nice to not have to plug in every time I work with my Dremel. Battery doesn't last long enough and takes way too long to charge. The switch is sensitive and you have to fiddle with it to get it turned off. For those 2 things, the battery and switch it looses 2 stars. I'll be looking for another brand that has a better switch and more battery life.
customer_reviews.author: R. Muller

customer_reviews.title: Not worthy of the Dremel name.
customer_reviews.text: It's a real shame that Dremel put this product out. I've had a bunch of corded Dremel tools and they are excellent. This thing can't even get a cut through a piece of styrene without struggling and then the battery is done. So underpowered, I can't imagine an application that it could useful for. If you're going to get a Dremel tool, go with a corded version, maybe their other cordless are better, but I can't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: David James Butler

customer_reviews.title: Really handy to have around
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had it long enough to know how the battery fares with it being left on the shelf much of the time, but man is it handy to have a battery operated Dremel. The cords always got in the way and were often inconvenient. The battery operated Dremel is just wonderful. I also got the case for it. -Matt
customer_reviews.author: M. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: OK for some things but not much power
customer_reviews.text: Might be OK for polishing a small coin or something like that but not much more. Barely cut through a small thin piece of plastic car molding. Dremel makes some fine tools, but this one has so little power that it should not be called an automotive "tool." Save your money and buy a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Use for Dog Nail grinding...works like a charm and better than paying groomer fees!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to grind my large dog's nails (60lbs), I was taking him to the groomer every 2-3 weeks to keep them short so they didn't scratch wood floors; Groomers were charging $13/visit...so it made sense that once my dog was completely at ease having his nails ground at the groomers, that he would allow me to do it at home...well worth the upfront cost since this will literally save me over $225 a year in groomers fees! I've used 3x on my dog now and it works like a charm on the low setting and he willingly lets me do it. I may even find other functions to use the Dremel for, wouldn't' hesitate recommending this!
customer_reviews.author: Dreaming of HawaiiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dremel for action figure customizing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this specifically for use in action figure customizing, and for that purpose it performs more than adequately. As this may be the only review of this product for the use stated that you'll ever see on this site, I'll provide a bit of a warning... You will find that this tool works very quickly when the material it's being used on is plastic. Accordingly, check often when applying even the least coarse grinding stone or what have you, as you'll otherwise find you've taken away more material than you'd wanted. Beyond that, everything else with regard to a Dremel and action figures is self-explanatory I should think, and if not, this isn't really the place to cover it.
customer_reviews.author: 3.75 inch collector

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool but with a poorly written manual.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this cool tool works because they sold me this dremel tool with bits that don't fit!!! I need to go out my way and buy extra extension parts. 2/5, all day everyday! Thanks for nothing! Update. I added two more stars giving this Dremel tool a 4/5, thanks for the manual never explaining to simply unscrew the tip of the collet extension and fit the cutting/grinding wheel into the extension then screw back the tip! Works excellent. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: El Capitan

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, multi-purpose
customer_reviews.text: Good battery life on this unit. We purchased this to help with our dog's nails, and it heats up a bit much for this. You just have to take breaks when using it. All the accessories that came along with this unit are perfect, though. You have every possible tip and attachment you could ever need. This is really a fine tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Uses for dog nails. Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: We use it for our big great dane’s nails. They are super thick so regular pet Dremels don’t work. So far they have been great. Love that it’s cordless and has a recharchable battery. We can pick the speed and make sure it doesn’t buff too much. Great and cheap product. I rdon’t commend this over any “pet filer”
customer_reviews.author: Diana Leja

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better tool than this one.
customer_reviews.text: Dremel's made a near useless tool with this 7.2 volt dud. After 3 years of very low usage, the high speed setting doesn't work. The battery is dead, the aftermarket battery barely functions. It has very little torque. Buy a better tool. You won't be happy with this budget POS..
customer_reviews.author: tripleb

customer_reviews.title: Great Dremel - Attachments not so much
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so that I could do some DIY projects around the house. I wanted to make sure it was cordless and had all the necessary power that I needed to do my work. The Dremel itself: Powerful Great battery Quality build The attachments: Some are useful, others pretty much fell apart on contact (here's looking at you grinder attachment thing) Given the fact that at the time of writing this is down to $43 bucks, I would say it's more than worth it - just make sure you pick up some extra attachments.
customer_reviews.author: King of the Stream

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Returning for replacement. Seriously dangerous faulty on/off switch!! Bought a replacement, it has the same switch issue. Batteries don’t hold a charge. The tool has no power. Any pressure and it stops
customer_reviews.author: Dale Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Great for scratches removal.
customer_reviews.text: Here is the story: I ran through bushes on my car so had a few dozen scratches on the side of it. Some of them bumper-to-bumper... At first I was really upset. Especially taking into account it was a new car. But this little device saved me big bucks. Although it took some time to remove all the 'marks' from the body of the car, I was very satisfied with result. I could barely see any hints of remaining scratches. The only caveat - do not try to use it on matte surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to get excited about.
customer_reviews.text: Basic, simple Dremel tool. DOES NOT WORK WITH Dremel router and drill press accessories. If you need to use accessories, as opposed to bits, check compatibility first. Mine fell about 1 foot onto concrete floor. Has never worked reliably since then. It should be able to handle a 1 foot drop. My next Dremel too, will NOT be this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gauntletwielder

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Actually my 4th Dremel. I had 2 other cordless and a plug in. Had to go back to cordless. Great for dog's nails, my nails, polishing metal, any off job. This one has more power than the other, better, yeah!!! John's wife...
customer_reviews.author: john P

customer_reviews.title: Was disappointed in how long it held it's charge
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed in how long it held it's charge, after using it a few times I would have like to return it but it was no longer returnable through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: C. Spessert

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This is Junk. It has a fragile plastic feel, unlike any Dremel I've held in the past. The speed switch design is pathetic and actually adangerous due to the possibility of a short. Mine won't do the fast speed. The low speed is weak and easy to stop spinning with a bit of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: William Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price, quick shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I bought this for my dog's nails. It is complete overkill for that, but it does EVERYTHING! I had no idea how much I needed this until I started using it. Sure you can do the dog's nails, sand little burrs off anything (like lamps or ceramic dishes that scratch your wood furniture), or engrave stuff; but you can also use it on drywall ... have you ever had to patch it because ... well, kids. Cut out the jagged part, change the tip and smooth out the edges with this little gem without pulling out the big tools! I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Batteries don't last long
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is a major issue especially since it takes 3 hours to recharge and I would recommend having several batteries and even a couple chargers on hand to try and keep a decent ability to maintain work. Other than the battery issue this tool functions well and the portability being cordless is convenient as long as it isn't needed for any extended use without backup batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Richard (Ted) Beason Jr

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Needs more power. I got it to do my dogs nails and it’s just not powerful enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jride20z

customer_reviews.title: It's just okay, doesn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: While it lasts, it's an okay product. I only used it to trim my dogs nails. Battery doesn't hold a charge for long. And with little use the entire unit stopped working. I would not recommend this product. Searching now for a better version that works better, lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: KSF

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog nails
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh!!! I purchased this for my grumpy dog so I could trim nails fast without sharp objects the could get hurt when flailing!! I was able to trim all three dogs with relative little argument. Trimmed one of the most resistant again today with no fight!! This tool is AWESOME!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly to trim the nails on my dogs. I have a corded heavier duty rotary tool but rarely take it out of the box anymore. This one does a great job and has plenty of power for most smaller jobs. I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: BMAC

customer_reviews.title: So-so product.
customer_reviews.text: Factory sealed package but some the small cutting wheel was broken, the lighter sanding tools are not solidly coated with grit. They probably will not stand up to much use. I am using this to trim my dog's toenails so it's okay. If you need it for heavier use, this probably isn't for you.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Neat Concept, weak motor. I can stop it with my fingers by squeezing the rotating head.
customer_reviews.text: Neat concept but the weak motor comes to a stop every easily. I can stop it with my fingers by squeezing the rotating head. The portability is nice and it works well but expected a lot more power.
customer_reviews.author: Brook

customer_reviews.title: Great for filing dogs' nails
customer_reviews.text: I use this mainly to start filing down my dogs' nails, then I finish with the Pedi Paws. The Dremel is quite fast and rough, where the Pedi Paws is a bit slower. I wish the switch to turn it off was at the end, because when I only have one hand available, it's not easy to turn off -- I usually end up turning it to the higher setting then switching it back. I don't use the other pieces in the set, so I can't comment on those. But this works as expected and charges perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Gal

customer_reviews.title: battery life is surprisingly good, and the accessories that come with it are ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, battery life is surprisingly good, and the accessories that come with it are pretty good as well. I'm glad I went with this one vs. the 4.4V (I think) version, as this extra power is definitely needed for doing what I do with it (trimming dog nails, very minor projects here and there) It shows you can sharpen a lawnmower blade with it, but that is extremely laughable. It's definitely not meant for that. But for very small stuff, it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for pet dog nail trimming
customer_reviews.text: We use this to trim our lab's nails (dog, pet). We initially bought the Pet Dremel which was ok for a little while then the strength greatly decreased. This regular Dremel is strong and gets the job done well.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren YoderTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good power for a smal cordless tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful little Dremel. I use it to trim my dog's nails, but it would be suitable for other small jobs as well. I replaced an older Craftsman cordless Dremel as buying a new battery for that one was no cheaper than a new model. The 7700 is a bit more powerful which is good. It's also a bit bigger and heaver which I don't like as well, but it feels more balanced. Depending on your dog this might be too powerful for nail trimming, especially at the higher speed. For my dog it's best to get the job done as quickly as possible so it works well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Good kit - good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on finishing my 3d prints. I think it is too powerful for that, or my hand is not too steady- I suppose your mileage may vary . The Dremel is handy for other uses around the house, and meets my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Mike

customer_reviews.title: Sceptical
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product after trying the pedipaws for my Husky mix, the pedipaws didn't work at all. However, this product turned out to be a delightful surprise. The only complaint that I have, and it probably won't happen for all of them, but when I first tried to charge the battery it wasn't making enough connection to charge it. I ended up having to rubberband the battery to the charger for it to charge, but now it works just fine. I was able to grind my two dogs nails down in one charge.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Cioppa

customer_reviews.title: Product faulty from the start. Hold / depress button ...
customer_reviews.text: Product faulty from the start. Hold / depress button for the lock and turn spring was not working, after a couple of hours with battery in it, Literally started smoking. If I left it in my tool box it could've even started a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Cross

customer_reviews.title: Dremel GOOD!!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is very good. I am a groomer and have used this same model for 5 years before it needed replaced. I ordered the same one since the first one has been so good. The nice thing is this new one is quieter so far, which helps not scare the dogs when I do the nails. It is a little less quality with the plastic housing but seems to work fine. I read other reviews before ordering and they mentioned the battery housing came off easily but mine is just fine. Another plus, the old battery, which is still good, fits the new dremel. Thank you so much for a good product.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Faulty Battery
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about 2 months, then the battery just stopped working. I used this to cut off a stripped screw and while it does work with A LOT of patience, the blade speed is way too slow. The adjustment levels are also not that great. When the battery did work, i found the charge did not last that long. What good is a tool if you have to constantly charge it before finishing the job you intended to use it for. I would NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Had Both Styles, they die so fast!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had both styles of Dremel Cordless Rotary Tools, (mini mite and this 1). Both got a max of a cpl years of intermittent use. The batteries die even faster, and/or the chargers do the exact same thing. I’m now looking for a corded Dremel. To hopefully avoid having re-buy one, every 12-24 mos.!
customer_reviews.author: Jill O.

product_meta.title: Dremel 7700-1/15 MultiPro 7.2-Volt Cordless Rotary Tool Kit
product_meta.description: DE7700-1/15 Features: -Cordless rotary tool kit. -Two speed. -Ideal for sanding, carving and drilling. -Medium duty that goes anywhere. Generic Specifications: -7.2 V. Dimensions: Overall Height - Top to Bottom: -10 Inches. Overall Width - Side to Side: -3.3 Inches. Overall Depth - Front to Back: -6.5 Inches. Overall Product Weight: -3.1 Pounds.
feature_bullets: The product is 7.2V CDLS Rotary Tool
NOTE: Please refer to the user manual before use
Two speeds 10,000 and 20,000 rpm to match the proper speed required
Removable 7.2-Volt Ni-Cad battery pack lets you use additional packs for continuous use
3-hour charger with LED light shows proper charging
Compact and lightweight for easier handling and less fatigue

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,585 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
